articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts from Russians
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Gifts from Russians
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from Mikhail Gagloyev, managing director of "Temp Bank" Moscow Stock Bank of Russian Public Company, and P. A. Petrov, general manager of Rizer Konsalt Companies Group of Russia.
					 The gifts were conveyed to the DPRK ambassador to Russia and an official of the DPRK mission in Russia by the managing director and the general manager.

articles.title: FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. Secretary of State's Reckless Remarks against DPRK
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Denounces U.S. Secretary of State's Reckless Remarks against DPRK
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Thursday as regards the U.S. cunning moves at the ministerial meeting of ASEAN Regional Forum held in Laos to lay the blame for the escalating tension on the Korean peninsula at the door of the former, while taking issue with its self-defensive nuclear deterrent:
					 U.S. Secretary of State Kerry spouted out foolish remarks that the U.S. has no hostile intent against north Korea at the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum on July 26.
					
					 Why is the U.S. resorting to reckless saber-rattling, openly vociferating about "beheading operation" and "occupation of Pyongyang" after introducing all kinds of strategic assets into south Korea if it has no hostile intent against the DPRK?
					
					 The successive U.S. presidents personally made public appearances and openly included the DPRK, a dignified sovereign state, on the list of preemptive nuclear attack while terming it "part of an axis of evil" and "a country that has to be removed" and cried out for "collapse of system." How can this be understood?
					
					 Kerry asserted the joint military exercises have never posed problems and the DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework was concluded with joint military exercises going on. This is sophism enough to make even a cat laugh.
					
					 As he holds the post of the U.S. Secretary of State, he should know the historical facts that once joint military exercises were suspended after the U.S. complied with the demand of the DPRK for it and that those exercises have been one of major causes that made the hard-won DPRK-U.S. agreements go bust.
					
					 The U.S. joint military exercises on the Korean peninsula are not attributable to the DPRK's access to nukes but because the U.S. steadily increased nuclear threats while ceaselessly holding war exercises for aggression, the DPRK was compelled to opt for having access to nuclear deterrence and bolster it up.
					
					 The true aim sought by the U.S. is to shift the blame for the tension on the Korean peninsula on to the DPRK, secure a pretext for its arms buildup and joint military exercises pursuant to its rebalancing strategy in Asia-Pacific for aggression, and dodge the neighboring countries' protest and criticism of its decision to deploy THAAD in south Korea as an immediate task.
					
					 No one can predict what situation the U.S. reckless arms buildup and the upcoming August joint military exercises will create on the Korean peninsula and in its vicinity.
					
					 The U.S. frantic hostile policy toward the DPRK will prompt the DPRK to do everything it can to defend its sovereignty and dignity, and the U.S. will be held accountable for all the ensuing consequences.

articles.title: Director General of Department of U.S. Affairs of FM Interviewed by Chief of AP Pyongyang Bureau
articles.content:
Director General of Department of U.S. Affairs of FM Interviewed by Chief of AP Pyongyang Bureau
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The director general of the Department of U.S. Affairs of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Thursday was interviewed by the chief of AP Pyongyang Bureau on a visit to the DPRK on the recent situation on the Korean peninsula.
					 Answering the question as to the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula, the director general clarified that it is the DPRK's just right to take the toughest counteraction against the U.S. as it went beyond the "red line" in the standoff with the DPRK and declared a war against the DPRK by daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. recent moves such as ceaseless introduction of strategic assets to the vicinity of the Korean peninsula and decision to deploy THAAD in south Korea hint that it will stage unprecedented maneuvers during the joint military drill to be held in August, he said, clarifying that if an undesirable event occurs on the peninsula during the joint military drill, the U.S. would be held wholly responsible for it and that the DPRK is fully ready for any physical steps.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK will continue to take the tough counteraction against the U.S. unless it rolls back its hostile policy towards the DPRK aiming at "bringing down its social system.

articles.title: NPCK Spokesman Calls for Struggle for Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
articles.content:
NPCK Spokesman Calls for Struggle for Pullback of U.S. Forces from S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- After deciding to deploy THAAD in south Korea, the U.S. recently transferred a battery of PAC-3 to the base of U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in Kunsan, North Jolla Province of south Korea from the U.S. Air Force's Kadena base, Okinawa.
					 Earlier, the U.S. decided to deploy on a permanent basis nuclear-powered submarine Mississippi and super-large nuclear-powered Ohio, which had entered Pusan Port, in the waters surrounding the Korean peninsula. The U.S. is blustering that it would additionally deploy improved PAC-3 MSE, whose maximum altitude is twice that of PAC-3 now deployed in the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea.
					
					 A spokesman for the National Peace Committee of Korea (NPCK) said in a statement on Thursday:
					
					 These are extremely dangerous military provocations as they further escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula and disturb the regional peace and security.
					
					 To force the U.S. imperialist aggressor troops to pull out of south Korea is the basic way of foiling the U.S. frantic armed buildup for a nuclear war and preventing a nuclear war disaster on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. troops in south Korea are like a time bomb planted in the powder keg for a nuclear war and the withdrawal of the U.S. troops is the most urgent matter which brooks no further delay.
					
					 The struggle to defuse the danger of a nuclear war on the peninsula and guarantee the regional peace and security should start from pulling the U.S. troops out of south Korea.
					
					 The DPRK, which joined the front rank of nuclear powers, is now fully ready to cope with all forms of wars to be ignited by the U.S. imperialists, and the U.S. troops in south Korea will be the primary target of our merciless deadly strike.
					
					 The U.S. should properly face up to the strategic position of the DPRK and the trend of the times and behave itself and pull the aggressor forces and war equipment out of south Korea without delay.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities sincerely hope for peace and reunification, they should roll back their despicable sycophantic pro-U.S. policy and make a resolute decision to withdraw the U.S. aggressor forces from south Korea, as unanimously demanded by all Koreans.

articles.title: Military, Naval and Air Attache of Chinese Embassy Gives Reception
articles.content:
Military, Naval and Air Attache of Chinese Embassy Gives Reception
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Military, Naval and Air Attache of the Chinese Embassy here Zhang Ping  gave a reception at his embassy Thursday on the 89th anniversary of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
					 Present there on invitation were officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Present there were Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Li Jinjun and his embassy officials.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting Held at Indonesian Embassy
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting Held at Indonesian Embassy
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting took place at the Indonesian Embassy here on Thursday to mark the Day of the National Children of Indonesia.
					 Present at the meeting were Indonesian Ambassador Bambang Hiendrasto, his embassy staff members, Jo Chol Ryong, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Association, teachers and students of DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Ryulgok Senior Secondary School in Songyo District.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance given by children of the embassy and Korean students and played sports and amusement games.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Departs from Vientiane
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Departs from Vientiane
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho departed from Vientiane on Thursday after taking part in the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum held in Laos.

articles.title: DPRK Handball Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Handball Players Back Home
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK handball players came back home Wednesday after taking part in the IHF Trophy Tournament East and Southeast Asia held in Hong Kong, China from July 20 to 24.
					 It brought together teams of six countries and regions including the DPRK, Vietnam, Mongolia and Taipei of China.
					
					 The men and women players of the DPRK beat all their rivals, bagging gold medals.
					
					 Choe Pong Im and Ri Kyong Song were awarded the best prizes.
					
					 The players were greeted at Pyongyang Railway Station by Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials concerned and their families, players and coaches.

articles.title: World Hepatitis Day Marked
articles.content:
World Hepatitis Day Marked
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- There took place an event at the National Blood Center under the Ministry of Public Health Thursday to mark the World Hepatitis Day.
					 Present there were officials in the field of public health and media, members of missions of the international organizations here including the acting representative of the WHO and the UN resident coordinator who is UNDP resident representative and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 The speakers stressed the need for all countries of the world to briskly conduct the hygienic information service on hepatitis and intensify its prevention and treatment.
					
					 Referring to the importance of combating hepatitis, they said they would make efforts to raise social concern and enthusiasm for rendering aid to this in order to completely eradicate hepatitis.
					
					 The participants heard data on prevention and control of hepatitis.
					
					 They watched science film "Let Us Prevent Hepatitis B" and enjoyed a performance given by the hygienic squad of medical workers.

articles.title: Significance of DPRK's Victory in Korean War
articles.content:
Significance of DPRK's Victory in Korean War
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung, the army and people of the DPRK won the 1950-1953 Korean War, provoked by the U.S. imperialists, and thus reliably defended the freedom and independence of the country but also the peace of the world.
					 Many analysts of the world contended that the U.S. ignited the war in an aim to conquer the DPRK and then dominate the world through a great nuclear war.
					
					 It is well evidenced by the facts that the then U.S. President Truman announced a nuclear blackmail statement indicating the use of A-bombs and declared a "state of national emergency" for preparations of the 3rd World War when the Korean War broke out.
					
					 In particular, when the "general Christmas offensive" was led to a general retreat on the part of the U.S. side, Truman declared at a press conference that the U.S. would employ all necessary means, including A-bombs, to cope with the new situation created in Korea.
					
					 Foreign news reports told that Truman had planned to exterminate 700 millions of population by making nuclear attacks on the DPRK, China and the Soviet Union with the Korean War as a starting point.
					
					 According to declassified documents of U.S. military institutions, U.S. President Eisenhower made a demand for the prompt use of A-bombs five times during the war.
					
					 However, the U.S. scheme for a nuclear war came to a failure with the DPRK's victory in the war.
					
					 But for the ideological, moral, strategic and tactical might of the DPRK, the world would have faced a nuclear disaster.
					
					 In this point of view, the DPRK's victory in the Korean War was of weighty significance as it contributed to preventing a nuclear war on a worldwide scale and defending the global peace.
					
					 The U.S. should ponder over the fair advice of the world public that if a war breaks out again in the Korean peninsula, the U.S. will meet its final destruction by the dreadful strikes from the DPRK which has ranked itself among the nuclear powers, the attacks more powerful that what the former suffered in the last war.

articles.title: Signal Successes Made in Chemical Industry
articles.content:
Signal Successes Made in Chemical Industry
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Big efforts have been paid to putting the production on a Juche basis in the field of chemical industry of the DPRK.
					 According to Kim Chon Su, a department director of the Ministry of Chemical Industry, many chemical factories across the country made a big stride forward in putting production on a Juche basis during the 70-day campaign.
					
					 The Hungnam Fertilizer Complex and Namhung Youth Chemical Complex established the system for normalizing the production of Juche fertilizer, while the Sunchon Chemical Complex equipped itself with the process of acrylic paints.
					
					 The Sinuiju Chemical Fiber Mill built a process for making straw pulp with new additives and the February 8 Vinalon Complex a process for manufacturing salt in a mechanized way.
					
					 A work for establishing C1 chemical industry on the basis of coal gasification has been pushed forward.
					
					 Technical preparations for perfecting the sodium carbonate industry were finished and study for home production of ten kinds of catalysts came to an end.

articles.title: Frame-work for Skyscrapers Finished in Ryomyong Street of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Frame-work for Skyscrapers Finished in Ryomyong Street of Pyongyang
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Skyscrapers have taken their framed shapes one after another in Ryomyong Street under construction in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK.
					 The framework for 50- and 55-storied apartment houses was successfully finished in a matter of 100 days with the introduction of rational building methods.

articles.title: Intellectual Product Exhibition Closes
articles.content:
Intellectual Product Exhibition Closes
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- An intellectual product exhibition closed with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex on Thursday.
					 The exhibition that opened on July 20 drew attention of the participants as exhibits were of great economic profitability and practical significance.
					
					 During the period of the exhibition there was brisk distribution of intellectual products for applying to production and construction hundreds of new technical proposals conducive to improving the people's standard of living.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and inventors.
					
					 The jury announced the results of the exhibition and cups and certificates were awarded to the successful units, scientists, technicians and working people.
					
					 And inventors received WIPO MEDAL FOR INVENTORS and certificates for their project "LED Floodlight with Secondary Reflector" and so on.
					
					 Ri Chung Gil, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, made a closing address.

articles.title: State Merited Chorus Celebrate Anniversary of War Victory
articles.content:
State Merited Chorus Celebrate Anniversary of War Victory
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The State Merited Chorus gave a performance before full houses at the People's Theatre Wednesday, the anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers like male chorus "To a Decisive Battle", orchestral music and male chorus "Song of Proud Guards Units" and orchestral music and serial songs "July 27, Our Victory Day".
					
					 The performers highly praised the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in winning victory in the war.
					
					 As the image of the President was presented in the background of the stage the audience was wrapped in the feelings of reverence for him.
					
					 The atmosphere of the performance mounted with male chorus "We Will Uphold the Leadership of the Party with Loyalty" which sang of the burning will of all service personnel and people to uphold the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un with  loyalty in the confrontation with the U.S. and in the building of a powerful socialist country just as the preceding generation invariably took the road of revolution following the great leaders. 
					
					 Duet piano "For Revolution", orchestral music and male chorus "We Will Go On and On along the Road of Loyalty" and male chorus "Long Live July 27, Victory Day" which were newly created by the State Merited Chorus instilled into the audience the immutable truth that July 27, victory day is always in store for all the service personnel and people who are advancing along the road of the final victory, firmly convinced of the validity of their cause and strength.
					
					 Watching the performance were Hwang Pyong So, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior party, state and army officials, officials of the party and armed forces organs, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, war veterans, wartime meritorious persons, those who distinguished themselves in aiding the army, labor innovators and youths and students in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Right to Existence Achievable Only through Struggle: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Right to Existence Achievable Only through Struggle: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The south Korean peasants are now staging brisk actions against the conservative authorities' misrule.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in an article in this regard: 
					
					 Their massive struggle is an eruption of the pent-up resentment and grievance against the foreign forces' colonial enslavement policy to devastate agriculture and the south Korean authorities' policy to ruin agriculture. 
					
					 It is mainly attributable to the U.S. imperialists' colonial enslavement policy that the south Korean agriculture has gone bankrupt and the living of the peasants deteriorated.
					
					 The U.S. considers south Korea as no more than a market for its surplus goods and dumping ground.
					
					 The food production is decreasing in south Korea every year, but many areas of cultivated land have turned into military bases of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and their war drill grounds.
					
					 The successive puppet ruling quarters' policy of bringing profits to outside forces by selling off the interests of the people is an important factor of bringing the south Korean agriculture to ruin and impoverishing peasants.
					
					 The situation goes to clearly prove that the south Korean peasants can never get rid of their miserable plight as long as the U.S. colonial enslavement policy and the Park Geun Hye group's moves to ruin agriculture persist.
					
					 The right to existence can be achieved only through a struggle. Victory is always in store for the people staging united actions for independent life and right.

articles.title: No Future for Japan Denying Crime-woven History: Minju Joson
articles.content:
No Future for Japan Denying Crime-woven History: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of Germany recently opened to public that the issue of defining the killing of natives in Namibia more than 110 years ago as massacre and making an apology for it is under discussion.
					 Germany officially admitted its historical crime and decided to express an apology to its victims even though more than a century has passed since then. There is, however, such shameless country as Japan behaving quite contrary to this.
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday says this in a commentary.
					
					 Recalling that the Japanese reactionaries have never made any sincere apology for their past crimes but persistently distorted history, sparking off surging indignation among those countries which fell victims to Japan, the commentary goes on:
					
					 Shortly ago, they left no means untried to deter the application for the registration of the records on the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army as a world heritage made by non-governmental organizations in Asia and Europe from being accepted.
					
					 Very clear is the ulterior aim sought by them in denying the hideous unethical crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past.
					
					 It is their scenario to keep its crime-woven history hidden forever by disguising Japan as "victim," not assailant, and realize the old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" in the last century by launching continental reinvasion when an opportunity presents itself.
					
					 This tells that their persistent distortion of history is not limited to the issue of whether they admit their wrongdoings or not, but it is a serious political matter as they seek to realize their ambition for overseas aggression at any cost by leading Japan to militarism.
					
					 There is no future for those who deny their crime-woven history challenging the conscience of mankind hoping for justice and truth.

articles.title: U.S. Mulls Deploying Improved PAC-3 MSE in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Mulls Deploying Improved PAC-3 MSE in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed on July 25 that the U.S. is going to deploy improved PAC-3 MSE, whose maximum altitude is twice that of PAC-3 now deployed in the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces present in south Korea.
					 Recently the U.S. announced the THAAD deployment in south Korea and is now mulling introducing PAC-3 MSE in a bid to build a missile shield for a nuclear war in Korea as early as possible.
					
					 It is by no means accidental that Chosun Ilbo said the introduction of the above-said one would help the U.S. forces establish multilayered missile shield of three stages such as THAAD, PAC-3 MSE and PAC-3.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Go Home after Abandoning Its Attempt for Permanent Stay in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Go Home after Abandoning Its Attempt for Permanent Stay in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article on its website on July 21.
					 The article said that 66 years have passed since the U.S. seized the OPECON over the south Korean puppet army.
					
					 The U.S. has run the whole gamut of gimmick to maintain the OPECON, the basic means for its forces' permanent presence in south Korea, it noted, and went on:
					
					 If the U.S. imperialists transfer the OPECON to the south Korean puppet regime, they will lose their justification to stay in south Korea and an excuse to interfere in the issue of Korea.
					
					 It is anachronistic for the U.S. to seek its forces' permanent presence in south Korea while regarding the Korean peninsula as a "sword" to annex the Eurasian continent and a springboard from which to dominate the world.
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime is a herd of traitors who can not be pardoned down through generations, being branded the colonial slaves in the 21st century, as they are leaving the prerogative of the supreme command over the army to the tender mercy of their master, being seized with sycophancy toward the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. should go to its den, abandoning its sinister attempt for its forces' permanent presence in south Korea.

articles.title: S. Korean Religious Bodies Call for Establishing Peace Mechanism on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
S. Korean Religious Bodies Call for Establishing Peace Mechanism on Korean Peninsula
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The Christian organizations of south Korea rejected the U.S. and the puppet authorities' moves to deploy THAAD and strongly called for establishing peace mechanism on the Korean peninsula, according to the south Korean CBS on July 25.
					 The Christian Solidarity for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a "National Assembly" seminar disclosing the injustice of the THAAD deployment and stressed the need to establish peace mechanism, noting that the THAAD deployment cannot pave the way for solving the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The Christian Youth Council in a lecture laid bare the danger of THAAD which would disturb peace on the peninsula.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Committee of Reconciliation and Reunification of the Council of Christian Churches is underscoring the necessity of concluding a peace treaty in U.S. streets from July 18 and visiting churches to conduct a campaign for voicing solidarity with this struggle.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Korean Scholar in U.S.
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Korean Scholar in U.S.
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Articles by Kim Ung Jin, a Korean scholar in the U.S., who was director of the Genome Research Institute of California Engineering College, were posted on website, evoking a lively response, according to the south Korean Dong-A Ilbo on July 26.
					 Articles praising President Kim Il Sung were posted by him on website from 2014.
					
					 A lot of compatriots and peoples of all social standings in south Korea express support for the articles and post articles responding to them and those introducing the DPRK.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed by Newspapers of Russia, Tanzania
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed by Newspapers of Russia, Tanzania
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Russia and Tanzania dedicated special write-ups to the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Russian newspaper Nakhodkinski Rabochi on July 21 carried an article titled "Destiny of country and people" illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 July 27 is the historic day when the DPRK won the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, the newspaper said, noting that the U.S. imperialists were brought to their knees before the army and people of the DPRK united close around Kim Il Sung, man of brave pluck and ever-victorious stratagem.
					
					 The Tanzanian newspaper Uhuru on July 22 carried an article titled "Everlasting is tradition of victory in which DPRK defeated U.S. imperialism" illustrated with his photo dealing with his feats performed in winning victory in the war
					
					 The U.S. ignited a war of aggression to occupy the whole of Korea and after the war, too, has persisted in its moves to invade the DPRK, the newspaper said, and continued:
					
					 However, the U.S. suffered disastrous defeat and bitter failure every time.
					
					 The present reality vividly proves that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK goes total bankrupt. 
					
					 The Korean People's Army has grown to be the elite army capable of matching any forms of war wanted by the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK at an early date, bearing in mind that it may suffer big losses due to its bankrupt policy.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Switzerland
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Switzerland
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- The Swiss preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea jointly held a meeting, book and photo exhibition and film show on July 23 on the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Displayed at the venue of the event were photos dealing with the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed were their works, and books and photos introducing the victorious history of the DPRK.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said:
					
					 July 27, Juche 42 (1953) was the day of worldwide significance on which the army and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists under the wise guidance of the great Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, the invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 The shining victory in the Fatherland Liberation War is the proud fruition of the outstanding stratagem and war methods of Kim Il Sung and the single-minded unity of all the service personnel and other people around him.
					
					 In the postwar period the U.S. worked hard to ignite a war against the DPRK though it suffered defeat in the Korean War.
					
					 But the Korean people shattered all the moves of the provocateurs thanks to the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its might as a nuclear weapons state and the Korean People's Army as the matchless army which is capable of beating back any formidable enemy at one blow under the brilliant and outstanding Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The participants went round photos on display and watched Korean film "The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum".
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed in UK, Spain
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed in UK, Spain
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in the UK and a film show in Spain on July 22 and 23 on the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 "The Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum" and other Korean films were shown.
					
					 Harpal Brar, chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist), praised President Kim Il Sung as the invincible and iron-willed commander who honorably defended the freedom and independence of the DPRK by leading the Fatherland Liberation War to victory and brought about the beginning of a downhill turn for the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 More than 60 years have passed since the Armistice Agreement was signed but the U.S. still show its attempt at aggression against the DPRK, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK is remarkably bolstering up its nuclear deterrent to cope with the ever-mounting sanctions and pressure by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The DPRK has already proposed to replace the Armistice Agreement by a peace treaty and made sincere efforts to ensure peace and defuse tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. should accept the DPRK's proposal for peace and withdraw its forces from south Korea at once.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will certainly win victory in the struggle to carry out the cause of independence against imperialism under the guidance of the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We will extend invariable support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Germany
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Germany
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- There took place meetings in Erfurt and Hannover of Germany on July 22 on the 63rd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Germany said in a speech:
					
					 The Korean people humbled the arrogant U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world 63 years ago and won the great victory under the leadership of Comrade Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK won the only victories in the fierce confrontation with the U.S. under the Songun leadership of the great Comrade Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people will have the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and build a reunified and prosperous powerful country as they are led by the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, who is identical to the great Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Communist Party of Germany will always extend full solidarity to the just cause of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people.
					
					 The chief of the Hannover Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Germany praised Kim Il Sung as the father of the Korean nation, founder of socialist Korea who liberated Korea and defended the sovereignty and independence of the country by defeating U.S. and Japanese imperialism. His feats will be kept forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the world progressives, the chief noted.

articles.title: Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Anniversary of War Victory Observed in Bulgaria
Pyongyang, July 28 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in Sofia on July 21 on the 63rd anniversary of the great victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Displayed at the venue of the meeting were photos dealing with the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing Juche Korea.
					
					 Present there were officials of political parities and organizations of Bulgaria including the Bulgarian Communists' Party, the Bulgarian Communists Union, the Bulgarian Anti-Fascist Union, the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, the Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and other people.
					
					 Atanas Ivanov, chairman of the Bulgarian Communists Union, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter said that the U.S. ignited the Korean War prompted by its ambition to dominate Northeast Asia and, furthermore, the rest of the world with the Korean peninsula as a springboard. He went on:
					
					 Thanks to the rare stratagem and outstanding strategy and tactics of Comrade Kim Il Sung, the U.S. suffered a bitter defeat and was brought to its knees before the army and people of the DPRK on July 27, 1953.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its might as the world's military power under the wise guidance of Comrade Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward to completion the idea and cause of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Speakers said that the U.S. imperialists dare not ignite a war again on the Korean peninsula entirely because they are afraid of the DPRK's capabilities for self-defense. Korea is sure to be reunified under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, they noted, extending full support and solidarity to the Korean people's just cause.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX condena palabras absurdas de Kerry en la reunion de ASEAN
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX condena palabras absurdas de Kerry en la reunion de ASEAN
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ACNC) -- En entrevista con la ACNC ofrecida el dia 28 con respecto a que en la reunion ministerial del Foro Regional de la Asociacion de Naciones del Sudeste Asiatico (ASEAN), Estados Unidos maniobro astutamente para imputar a la RPDC la responsabilidad de la agravacion de tension en la Peninsula Coreana cuestionando el disuasivo nuclear de autodefensa de ella, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					En la reunion ministerial del Foro Regional de ASEAN celebrada el dia 26 en Laos, el secretario de Estado de Estados Unidos, Kerry, dijo unas palabras absurdas como que su pais no tiene la voluntad hostil sobre el Norte de Corea.
					
					Si esto fuera verdad, ?por que EE.UU. introduce sus propiedades estrategicas de varios tipos en el Sur de Corea y realiza imprudentes ejercicios belicos anunciando abiertamente la "operacion de descabezamiento" y la "ocupacion en Pyongyang"?
					
					?Como se puede interpretar el comportamiento de los presidentes estadounidenses que incluyeron a la RPDC, Estado soberano muy digno, en la lista de blancos de ataque nuclear preventivo y abogaron por el "derrumbe de su regimen" describiendola personalmente como "eje del mal" y "pais a ser eliminado"? 
					
					Kerry dijo que no fueron cuestionados nunca los ejercicios militares conjuntos y aun cuando estos continuaban, se ha firmado el Acuerdo Basico RPDC-EE.UU, lo cual es otra sofisteria que hace morirse de risa.
					
					Si es secretario de Estado, el deberia saber el hecho historico de que al aceptar nuestra demanda, su pais habia suspendido el entrenamiento militar conjunto y que esto fue una de las principales causas que invalidaron los acuerdos dificilmente logrados entre ambas partes. 
					
					No es verdad que Estados Unidos lo desarrolla en la Peninsula Coreana debido al armamento nuclear de la RPDC. Por el contrario, nuestro pais se vio obligado a optar por poseer y aumentar su disuasivo nuclear porque aquel ejecuta sin parar los ejercicios de guerra de agresion y recrudece continuamente la amenaza nuclear.
					
					La verdadera intencion de EE.UU. es imputar a la RPDC la responsabilidad de la exacerbacion de tension en la Peninsula Coreana y procurar la justificacion de aumento armamentista y ejercicios militares segun la agresiva estrategia de reequilibrio de Asia-Pacifico. Por inmediato, tratan de evadir las protestas y condenas de los paises perifericos, desatadas al conocerse la decision de EE.UU. de ubicar el THAAD en suelo surcoreano.
					
					Nadie puede prever cual circunstancia se dara en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno debido al imprudente aumento armamentista de EE.UU. y los inminentes ejercicios militares conjuntos de agosto.
					
					Mientras EE.UU. recrudece la campana hostil contra nuestro pais, haremos todo lo posible por defender la soberania y dignidad del pais y ese pais tendra que asumir la responsabilidad de todas las consecuencias.

articles.title: Japon debe reconocer su historia criminal como Alemania, subraya Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japon debe reconocer su historia criminal como Alemania, subraya Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el portavoz del MINREX de Alemania publico que esta en discusion el problema de definir como genocidio el incidente de asesinato a los aborigenes cometido hace mas de 110 anos en Namibia y pedir disculpas por el respecto.
					Asi el pais europeo reconocio oficialmente su crimen historico de hace mas de un siglo y decidio pedir disculpas a las victimas.
					
					Pero, existe un pais tan diferente y descarado que es Japon.
					
					Critica Minju Joson en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 28 y continua:
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses nunca se habian disculpado sinceramente por sus crimenes del pasado. Al contrario, montaron en colera a los paises victimas con su obstinada tergiversacion de la historia.
					
					Hace poco, obstaculizaron de una manera u otra el registro de los datos referentes a la esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones como patrimonio de memoria del mundo, solicitado por varias entidades civiles de Asia y Europa.
					
					El objetivo de ellos reside en encubrir la historia criminal del pasado al cambiar el estatus de su pais del culpable a la "victima" y reagredir al continente si se da la oportunidad.
					
					De esa manera, quieren realizar su anejado sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" que no pudieron hacer realidad en el pasado.
					
					La tergiversacion de la historia no es el simple problema de reconocer o no las culpas del pasado, sino el serio asunto politico para agredir a ultramar mediante la militarizacion.
					
					No habra futuro para los que niegan la historia criminal desafiando a la conciencia de la humanidad que desea la justicia y la verdad.

articles.title: Se puede defender con lucha el derecho a subsistencia, destaca Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Se puede defender con lucha el derecho a subsistencia, destaca Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 28 de julio (ACNC) -- Ahora, los campesinos surcoreanos dinamizan la lucha masiva contra las politicas traidoras de las autoridades conservadoras, lo cual es explosion del acumulado rencor sobre el colonialismo de las fuerzas extranjeras y la de supresion de agricultura de aquellas. 
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este jueves y continua:
					
					La politica de colonizacion del imperialismo norteamericano es el factor principal que arruina la agricultura y la vida de campesinos en el Sur de Corea. 
					
					Para EE.UU., la parte sur de la Peninsula Coreana no pasa de ser un mercado de mercancias sobrantes y un basurero. 
					
					En el Sur de Corea se disminuye cada ano la produccion de cereales y muchos terrenos cultivables se han convertido en las bases militares y campos de entrenamiento militar de las tropas norteamericanas. 
					
					Otra causa importante es la politica traidora de la camarilla titere de Park Geun-hye que enriquece a las fuerzas extranjeras vendiendo los intereses del pueblo. 
					
					La realidad demuestra que mientras prosigan esas politicas, los agricultores surcoreanos no podran salir de la miserable situacion de ahora. 
					
					El derecho a la subsistencia se conquista solo con la lucha. 
					
					Triunfara sin falta el pueblo que lucha con las fuerzas unidas por la vida y los derechos independientes.
